name: NLQ & Chart Generation
content:
NLQ Report Generation


Data:

This project is using Postgre SQL database


Objective

The application allows users to fetch data from a database using natural language queries and automatically visualize the retrieved data using various chart types. This tool simplifies data access and analysis for users who may not have technical expertise in SQL or data visualization.


Users Personas

  • Data Analyst
  1. Use Case: Quickly analyze trends and patterns without writing complex SQL queries.
  2. Example: "Show me the sales trends for the last quarter."
  • Business Manager
  1. Use Case: Gain insights into team performance or financial metrics without relying on technical teams.
  2. Example: "What is the total revenue for this month?"
  • Marketing Specialist
  1. Use Case: Analyze campaign performance data effortlessly.
  2. Example: "How many leads did the email campaign generate last week?"



Key Features

  • Natural Language Query Input: Users can type their questions in plain language.
  • Automated SQL Query Generation: Leverages Generative AI to convert the natural language query into an SQL query.
  • Data Retrieval: Connects to the database to fetch relevant data based on the generated SQL query.
  • Data Visualization: Automatically creates charts and graphs (e.g., bar charts, line charts, pie charts) to represent the fetched data visually.



Steps for Using the Application

1. Input Natural Language Query

  • Objective: Allow users to input their questions in plain language.
  • Example:
  • Input: "What are the top 5 products sold last month?"

2. Convert Query to SQL Using Generative AI

  • Objective: Automatically translate the natural language query into a valid SQL query.
  • Example:
  • Natural Language Query: "Show me the average sales per region."
  • Generated SQL: SELECT region, AVG(sales) FROM sales_table GROUP BY region;

3. Generate Visualizations Using Generative AI

  • Objective: Use the retrieved data to create intuitive charts and graphs.
  • Example:
  • Input Data: Sales data per region.
  • Generated Visualization: A bar chart showing average sales for each region.


Expected Outcomes

  • User-Friendly Data Access: Retrieve data without writing SQL queries.
  • Automated Visualizations: Quickly convert data into actionable visual insights.
  • Enhanced Decision-Making: Enable users to make data-driven decisions more effectively.


Benefits

  • Efficiency: Reduces the time and effort needed to access and analyze data.
  • Ease of Use: Empowers non-technical users to explore data independently.
  • Improved Insights: Provides clear and visually appealing representations of data.
